title: Fraudster who claimed £500k in benefits for a bad back caught dancing at a wedding and travelling to Paris
text:
Opinion BOOGIE BEHIND BARS Fraudster who claimed £500k in benefits for a bad back caught dancing at a wedding and travelling to Paris 
Maribel Milligan was seen dancing and had started up a business on the third floor of her home despite claiming she could barely walk By BRITTANY VONOW 4th February 2017, 12:43 am A FRAUDSTER who claimed £500,000 for having a bad back has been put behind bars after being caught dancing at a wedding. 
Maribel Milligan’s excuses were so far-fetched that they left jurors giggling – with the 53-year-old ultimately jailed for three years for illegally pocketing over £539,000 during her 11 year ruse. North News and Pictures Maribel Milligan was found guilty of deliberately claiming more than £500,000 of tax payer money North News and Pictures 5 The 53-year-old was seen dancing at a wedding despite claiming she was heavily disabled 
Teesside Crown Court heard the 53-year-old lived a “lavish” lifestyle, with prosecution pictures showing her outside the Eiffel Tower and dancing at a glittering wedding ceremony, the Gazette reported. 
But her “laughable” excuses for the deception were so far-fetched they sparked giggling from jurors during her week-long December trial. 
She was criticised in court with Judge Howard Crowson saying she had tried to portray herself as the victim – despite evidence showing she even went riding a bike and swimming in the sea while claiming the benefits. North News and Pictures 5 Milligan faced court, with jurors laughing at the outlandish claims she had made 
She even ran a massage parlour on the third floor of her home – requiring her to walk up steep stairs, despite claiming she could barely walk 20 metres before experiencing excruciating pain. 
Judge Howard Crowson said: “It was quite incredible to see you stepping swiftly from a chair and dancing with your husband. 
“You portrayed yourself at the trial as the victim – a person wronged.” 
He said that she had organised a “sophisticated” fraud system, which even saw her blaming her carer at one stage. 
Her scam was only unearthed after a whistle-blower called the benefit fraud hotline – with a three year investigation discovering she had taken more than £539,000 from 2002 by claiming hardship and severe disability. Judge Crowson added: “She was deceiving everyone.” 
Among her biggest deceptions was from Hammersmith and Fulham Council, which she took around £170,000 from despite not permanently residing there. 
But the court heard authorities knew of her dishonesty – with that council even sending her to Scotland for respite care. 
Defence said: “Technically she was not living constantly in Hammersmith and Fulham, but social services knew that 
“There’s no evidence of vehicles or holidays.” North News and Pictures Photos of Milligan swimming in the sea were also shown to the court North News and Pictures 5 Milligan claimed she could barely walk 20m without feeling excruciating pain 
But despite defence suggestions of suspending Milligan’s jail sentence, Judge Crowson said her health wasn’t bad enough to avoid custody. 
Ben Reid, from the CPS’ specialist fraud division, said: “While Maribel Milligan had a genuine disability and was entitled to some support, she deliberately went about claiming more than £500,000 of taxpayer’s money. 
“Through careful analysis of the evidence, the prosecution was able to demonstrate how these fraudulent benefit claims continued over a significant period of time.”
